text: Joydip Mukherjee or Joydeep Mukherjee is an Indian film director, actor and writer primarily associated with Bengali language films. ==Career== In 2008, Joydeep started his career with directed television drama serial. Then he directed two more dramas. In 2016, he debuted as a film director with the project of Indo-Bangla joint production thriller drama film Shikari share with Zakir Hossain Simanto. It became the highest-grossing Bengali film of 2016. ==Filmography== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:5%" | Year ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:20%" | Film ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:10%" | Director ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:10%" | Story writer ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:10%" | Screenwriter ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:10%" | Actor ! style="background:#B0C4DE; width:35%" | Notes |- | 2008 || Ekhane Aakash Neel (TV Serial)|| || || || || Debuted in television series |- | 2010 || Gaaner Oparey (TV Serial) || || || || || |- | 2014 || Byomkesh (TV Serial) || || || || || |- | 2015 || Bhengchi || || || || || |- | rowspan="2"|2016|| Shikari || || || || || First directed Bengali film and first collaboration between Shakib Khan and Joydeep Mukherjee pair. |- | Amoler Cabin || || || || || |- | rowspan="1"|2017|| Nabab |||||| || || Second collaboration between Shakib Khan and Joydeep Mukherjee pair after the success of the film Shikari. |- | rowspan="3"| 2018|| Chalbaaz || || || || || Third collaboration between Shakib Khan and Joydeep Mukherjee.
